description.p: This module contains utility functions for easier measurement and calculation of scheduler utilization, otherwise obtained from calling the more primitive statistics(scheduler_wall_time).
The simplest usage is to call scheduler:utilization(Seconds).

desc.p: A list of tuples containing results for individual schedulers as well as aggregated averages. Util is the scheduler utilization as a floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0. Percent is the same utilization as a more human readable string expressed in percent.

taglist.item: Scheduler utilization of a normal scheduler with number SchedulerId.
Scheduler utilization of a dirty-cpu scheduler with number SchedulerId.
Scheduler utilization of a dirty-io scheduler with number SchedulerId. This tuple will only exist if both samples were taken with sample_all/0.
Total utilization of all normal and dirty-cpu schedulers.
Total utilization of all normal and dirty-cpu schedulers, weighted against maximum amount of available CPU time.

desc.p: Return a scheduler utilization sample for normal and dirty-cpu schedulers.
Return a scheduler utilization sample for all schedulers, including dirty-io schedulers.

func.fsummary: Measure scheduler utilizations during a period of time.

desc.p: Measure utilization for normal and dirty-cpu schedulers during Seconds seconds, and then return the result.
Calculate scheduler utilizations for the time interval from when Sample was taken and "now". The same as calling scheduler:utilization(Sample, scheduler:sample_all()).

func.fsummary: Measure scheduler utilizations between two samples.

desc.p: Calculates scheduler utilizations for the time interval between the two samples obtained from calling sample/0 or sample_all/0.
